rule.name: Confusing BrExp
rule.description: Catches use of the assembly br expression that can be confused with an array index expression. See Issue 9738.

rule.name: Built-in Property Names
rule.description: Catches member variables and methods whose names conflict with built-in properties. See Issue 7066.

rule.name: Struct Constructor with Only Default Arguments
rule.description: Catches struct constructors that only have default arguments. Struct constructors will never be called with their default arguments in D. See Issue 7066.

rule.name: Delete Keyword is Deprecated
rule.description: Catches uses of the "delete" keyword.

rule.name: Duplicated attributes on a declaration
rule.description: Catches duplicate attributes on declarations

rule.name: Enum Array Literals in Structs
rule.description: Array literals declared as "enum" can cause huge amounts of unnecessary run-time allocation. Use "static immutable" instead.

rule.name: Deprecated Floating-Point Operators
rule.description: Many of the old floating-point comparison operators are now deprecated.

rule.name: If and Else Identical
rule.description: Catches "if" statements where the "then" and "else" conditions are the same.

rule.name: Self-Assignment
rule.description: Catches expressions where the left side of an assignment operator is the same as the right side.

rule.name: Useless Logical Operator
rule.description: Catches expressions where the left side of a logical operator is the same as the right side.

rule.name: Length Subtraction
rule.description: Flags code where the programmer may be triggering an integer underflow with array or container lengths. May be a false positive.

rule.name: Number Literal Style
rule.description: Flags numeric literals where underscores could improve readability.

rule.name: Non-Const Operator Overloads
rule.description: Checks that opCmp, toHash, opEquals, and toString are declared const in struct, interface, class, and union declarations.

rule.name: Incomplete Operator Overloading
rule.description: Checks that opCmp, toHash, and opEquals are either all declared or none of them are declared.

rule.name: Pok√©mon Exception Handling
rule.description: Checks for code that catches Throwable or Error.

rule.name: Backwards Slice Expressions
rule.description: Catches code where the left side of a slice expression is larger than the right.

rule.name: Phobos Naming Conventions
rule.description: Catches code where the Phobos naming conventions are violated

rule.name: Unused Variables
rule.description: Catches code where variables are not used. May have false positives in the presence of mixin statements.

rule.name: Unused Parameters
rule.description: Catches code where parameters are not used. May have false positives in the presence of mixin statements.

rule.name: Syntax Warnings
rule.description: Misc. sytnax warnings detected by the parser.

rule.name: Confusing Logical Operator Precedence
rule.description: Checks for code where parenthesis should be used to clarify && and || expressions. "a && b || c" parses as "(a && b) || c", though the code may have meant to be "a && (b || c)".

rule.name: Undocumented Public Symbols
rule.description: Checks for code where public declarations have no documentation comment.

rule.name: Function Attribute Placement
rule.description: Prefer int getStuff() const {} to const int getStuff() {}

rule.name: Comma Expression
rule.description: The comma expression is confusing. Avoid its use.

rule.name: Local Imports
rule.description: Non-selective local imports can cause symbols from the imported module to shadow symbols in the local scope with no warning. Use a selective import to avoid this. See this forum thread for details.
